text: The 2013-14 Austrian football championship was the 103rd season of a top Austrian league and the 40th under the name Bundesliga. The league was played by ten teams. They determined the Austrian football champions in four rounds. Lower Austria, Salzburg and Vienna each have two clubs, Carinthia, Upper Austria, Styria and Tyrol each have one. Burgenland and Vorarlberg were not represented by any team in Austria's top division. SV Grödig was promoted to the Bundesliga. In the 2013-14 season, as in previous years, ten clubs competed against each other in a total of 36 rounds. Each team played twice at home and away against every other team. FC Red Bull Salzburg secured the championship title. It was the 8th title. They were leaders from the first to the last round. The new Bundesliga record was set with 110 goals scored. The Bundesliga was sponsored by the sports betting provider tipp3 as the main sponsor. The subsponsor is the mobile phone provider T-Mobile Austria. The official league name is tipp3-Bundesliga powered by T-Mobile. The TV provider sky Deutschland AG had the rights to show all Bundesliga games in full length. ==Final table== Pl. Name M W D L P 1\.
